p: In this setting, the series by Petrilli et al. [ 8], in which 4103 patients were attended and 1999 were admitted to hospital, 15% of the overall cohort was found to have diabetes, which is not far from the prevalence of diabetes in the general population in their age range in the US. Thus, confirming what was found with Influenza A (H1N1) pandemic, Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) outbreaks, the present coronavirus epidemics does not seem to account for a much higher capacity to infect people with diabetes [ 9].
